crew.p: Supported by: State Culture Capital Foundation of Latvia, Latvian Academy of Culture

body.p: Reflection, body, line. What has been proposed and what decided?
Contemporary dance performance “Membra” is like a poem about the relationship between humans and destiny.

„At the festival „Patriarch’s Autumn” choreographer Agate Bankava showed her solo „Membra”. In Agates Bankavas shy insolent piece about a woman as a fragile and dangerous creature on a mirror floor under a giant mirror vagina,hair plays an important role. In one episode, Agate pulls out the hair from her already damaged hairstyle, licks it, carefully clings to the mirror, and licks it again. All the attention is on one hair. Almost the same as if we found only one hair in a bowl of soup. Other ingredients may have a lot of invisible poisons, but the nausea accompanies that one hair that may have been washed with a very eco-shampoo.” – Inta Balode, „Diena”.
